column3: I think this can be a static_assert
@theuni But `static_assert(…)` would require a constant expression (and hence not `pit != NULL`), right? :-)
Hmm, right. I suppose this would have to be a templated arg overloaded with nullptr_t to work, which would obviously be silly here. Nevermind!
The right change here might be to just only write to the pointer if it is given as argument... (e.g., a nullcheck branch not an assert)\n\nWill, in normal execution, the assert ever panic?

From how I read it the assertion will never panic, but I agree this should be a nullcheck branch. \n\nI see the two calls to `MarkBlockAsReceived(..)` which exclude the final param, on lines [2260](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/3908fc4728059719bed0e1c7b1c8b388c2d4a8da/src/net_processing.cpp#L2260) and [3192](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/3908fc4728059719bed0e1c7b1c8b388c2d4a8
@paveljanik Good point. Changed to `if (pit) { … }` for consistency and pushed. Looks good? :-)
Why do you use different style then the style used just before `return true`?\n
@paveljanik Are you referring to the braces? `if (…) …` vs. `if (…) { … }`?
